image.altText: A police officer wearing a bomb disposal outfit working on a bad with a bomb disposal robot next to them.

props.synopsis: Israel's foreign minister says his country will "demand" action against "rampant" antisemitism in the United Kingdom after Thursday's deadly terror attack at a Manchester synagogue.

title.children: Israel to 'demand' action from UK after deadly synagogue terror attack

image.altText: A woman wearing headphones and flowers in her hair looks at her phone in a room of people wearing headphones.

props.synopsis: The global COP climate talks have been a source of frustration and disappointment for Pacific nations. They hope hosting the event will change that.

title.children: After years of leading on climate, Pacific Islanders say they're 'owed a COP'

image.altText: A composite of an Asian woman with brown hair wearing pearls and holding up a finger, and Shinjiro Koizum, an Asian man smiling.

props.synopsis: Japan's Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba is stepping down as leader after only a year in the role. It has left his party looking for a new face — and the frontrunner options could not be more different.

title.children: Inflation and Trump changed Japan. Could an 'Iron Lady' or a political scion save it?

image.altText: collage of document extracts layer over square colour photo of smiling female teacaher and young student wearing hat

props.synopsis: Even after putting a stop to their abuser's access to students, Alliyah faced an uphill battle to get basic information about what had happened behind the scenes.

title.children: Sexual predator taught in Brisbane schools for nine years after parents' complaints

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: A Labor factional heavyweight is making the case for more federal politicians and longer, fixed parliamentary terms.

title.children: If these reforms succeed, Australia could have more politicians

image.altText: Fairy lights glow from behind plastic sheets on a building that says "Punka Pub" at dusk.

props.synopsis: Businesses hurt by stay-away orders issued during the search for alleged police killer Dezi Freeman say they are yet to receive the government support they were promised.

title.children: As the Dezi Freeman manhunt drags on, so do the dark days in Porepunkah

image.altText: James Cameron

props.synopsis: The Hollywood director has been present in the film space for many years but the emergence of AI and its power has him somewhat scared for the future.

title.children: 'Scares the hell out of me': James Cameron on the threat of AI

image.altText: Protest arrests Sydney Town Hall

props.synopsis: The unauthorised event was held in response to the interception of a Gaza-bound aid flotilla.

title.children: Protesters restrained at snap pro-Palestinian rally at Sydney Town Hall

image.altText: A man and woman give the thumbs-down behind a closed sign in a grand building.

props.synopsis: Australian travellers heading to the United States are being warned to expect disruptions with some tourist attractions closed, flights disrupted and national parks and museums affected.

title.children: 'We had no idea': Aussie tourists in limbo after US shutdown disrupts travel plans

image.altText: Sussan Ley with photos of her male predecessors behind her in the Liberal partyroom

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and opposition energy spokesperson Dan Tehan have both arrived home from trips abroad with a spring in their step.

title.children: Ley sends frontbenchers letters, Albanese reminds us he's home

image.altText: A large metal dome over a building

props.synopsis: Volodymyr Zelenskyy said more than 20 Russian drones had been deployed in the attack on the town of Slavutych that cut power to the nearby Chernobyl plant for three hours.

title.children: Ukraine accuses Russia of raising nuclear risk after Chernobyl power cut

image.altText: Keir Starmer

props.synopsis: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer has called for a "robust" response by the head of London's Metropolitan Police after an undercover investigation exposed the force's hidden culture of misogyny and racism.

title.children: BBC exposes hidden culture of misogyny and racism inside UK Police

image.altText: Blond boy with curly hair smiles at camera.

props.synopsis: Police have released the first image of Gus since his disappearance, with almost 50 members of the Australian Defence Force joining the search for the four-year-old in mid-north South Australia.

title.children: 'They just don't disappear into thin air': Police release first image of missing boy

image.altText: Reece Walsh directs prayer hands at the Lang Park crowd.

props.synopsis: It's that time of the week again. Test your news knowledge to see how much you remember for the week that was.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A game-winning shot, a Hollywood separation and a shock shutdown

image.altText: China 6G

props.synopsis: The new visa is designed to attract top global STEM talent but has sparked fierce backlash, with critics warning it could squeeze Chinese nationals out of the graduate job market.

title.children: A big change from Trump has prompted China to act. Not everyone is happy

image.altText: A group of men shout and hold their arms in the air at a protest outside

props.synopsis: The extent of the violence is still becoming clear after days of protests took place amid an internet blackout in the region of Kashmir administered by Pakistan.

title.children: Nine people killed in violent anti-government protests in Kashmir

image.altText: A black and white photo of a Jane Goodall as a toddler, hugging a toy chimpanzee in the sand

props.synopsis: Primatologist Jane Goodall has died aged 91, leaving behind an impressive legacy in science and conservation. Here's a look back at her life in photos.

title.children: Looking back at Jane Goodall's life in photos

image.altText: A pothole on a road in the foreground and three cars drive in the background  on roads.

props.synopsis: New data obtained by the ABC under Freedom of Information laws show the majority of claims for compensation by drivers encountering hazards on Victorian roads are being rejected.

title.children: Just 1 per cent of state's road damage compensation claims approved

image.altText: A red flag with CFMEU on it in white text.

props.synopsis: Jarrod Bleijie says the government will not abolish the union, as a major inquiry gets underway.

title.children: Deputy premier vows not to deregister Qld branch of CFMEU

image.altText: Horse with Buck written on saddle cloth

props.synopsis: As the Brisbane Broncos prepare to take on the Melbourne Storm in Sydney on Sunday, fans and mascots are gearing up for the match.

title.children: Mascots prepare to shine in NRL grand final clash between Storm and Broncos

image.altText: A composite image of Benjamin Netanyahu, Tony Blair and Donald Trump up close.

props.synopsis: A leaked document reveals details on how the authority charged with governing and rebuilding the Gaza Strip could operate, and how it could be structured.

title.children: Billionaires and 'housing schemes' floated in draft plan for Gaza's future

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and James Marape

props.synopsis: A landmark defence treaty between Australia and Papua New Guinea has been approved by PNG's cabinet, marking Australia first new alliance in more than 70 years.

title.children: PNG to provide 10,000 troops to Australia under new treaty plan

image.altText: A group of rescuers running towards a collapsed building

props.synopsis: The collapse of an Islamic boarding school in East Java in Indonesia has raised questions about the safety of Indonesian buildings, and whether some are ticking time bombs.

title.children: Indonesian school building collapse 'eye-opening' for disaster agency

image.altText: An illustration of an egg being inseminated, viewed under a microscope.

props.synopsis: Fertility treatments in NSW will be able to continue even in cases where the family donor limit has been breached after the state government issued a temporary exemption.

title.children: NSW families embroiled in IVF mix-up allowed to continue treatment

image.altText: NT Police Commissioner Michael Murphy standing at a lectern and looking up.

props.synopsis: An inquiry into recruitment processes for senior NT police positions recommends "significant improvements", noting there are "widely held beliefs" that "bias", "favouritism" and "nepotism" have impacted promotions within the force.

title.children: NT police recruitment processes need 'significant improvements', review finds

image.altText: Tiffany Wilkes hiking

props.synopsis: Queensland's child safety and domestic violence prevention minister says the death of a mother and her daughter has "shocked" the community.

title.children: Community 'shocked' by death of mother, daughter in suspected murder-suicide

image.altText: Tesla CEO Elon Musk at the White House.

props.synopsis: The Tesla and SpaceX CEO's net worth hit $US500 billion ($755 billion) on Wednesday, the "Real-Time Billionaires" tracker reported.

title.children: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Musk becomes world's first half-trillionaire

image.altText: A numbat on a log in a bushy area.

props.synopsis: Authorities say getting to close to numbats can make them anxious enough to abandon their young and are urging photographers to give the endangered animals their space.

title.children: Shutterbugs warned search for perfect shot is stressing out numbats

image.altText: cold and snowy conditions with a police person in a hi-vis vest

props.synopsis: Two bushwalkers with mild hypothermia have been walked out of Cradle Mountain National Park in Tasmania's central highlands after activating their emergency beacon on Wednesday night.

title.children: Rescued Cradle Mountain hikers recovering after overnight ordeal

image.altText: F1 driver standing on podium, hands on hips, winner's medal around his neck

props.synopsis: Max Verstappen has won the previous two grands prix in Formula 1, but this weekend's race in Singapore is the only circuit on the calendar on which he has never triumphed.

title.children: Having conquered the Green Hell, Verstappen now faces his F1 bogey track

image.altText: GFX of Reserve Bank of Australia exterior laid over generic ASX images

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank warns risks to the global financial system are "rising", not receding, and Australia is not immune from any fallout.

title.children: Overvalued markets 'vulnerable to sharp corrections' warns RBA

image.altText: A sketch of a woman with brown hair with her hand holding a tissue in front of her face.

props.synopsis: The 51-year-old's lawyer says she will appeal a jury verdict that found her guilty of three murders and attempted murder.

title.children: Mushroom murderer Erin Patterson to appeal guilty verdicts

image.altText: Teammates surround a smiling Scott Boland and ruffle his hair after he completes a Test hat-trick.

props.synopsis: With Australia's men's Test team largely settled, there are a few key spots that could hang on a handful of Sheffield Shield performances before the start of the Ashes.

title.children: Players to watch this Sheffield Shield season before the Ashes
